intro: Diandranthus szechuanensis, commonly known as the Sichuan diandranthus, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It typically thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and ornamental value, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
